title: Design and Evaluation of an E-Learning Module on Medical Research Methodology

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge and understanding of research methodologies
context.additional_context: eLearning module operation competency enhancement program for healthcare institution administrators/leaders. Self-directed learning via simulation and VR in digital device-provided environments

learning_goals: Learners acquire the competency to design medical research methodology education content using e-learning modules.

Applying interactive content development skills (3D modeling, user interaction design) in simulation/VR environments (e.g., Unity, Unreal Engine), learners create two or more educational modules achieving over 80% learner engagement (based on surveys) within six months

Learners develop three types of measurement tools (pre/post-tests, practical evaluations, project reviews) to assess science-related job competencies (experimental design, data analysis, report writing) according to corporate comprehensive evaluation systems within six months, and execute processes achieving over 80% evaluator agreement
Learners acquire methods to analyze the effectiveness of e-learning modules through learner perception surveys.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
